Improve the security, architecture and user experience of your digital services - and realise Single Sign-on, Smart Authentication and more - with AuthMachine, in days - not weeks or months. & Access Management that puts you in control and "just works".

OSS is still not understood by most people - despite its tremendous success since the early 1980s and explosion since the early 2000s.

fields.title: Implement Active users list UI in the Admin section
fields.description:
Task description

Implement updated Active Users List UI. This section allows admin to view the Active users list and filter them based on the parameters selected

Interactive prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/382949532

Definition of done

  1. User is able to view the Active Users list, including (Design - https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/382949532)
    1. Username
      1. User can go to a user details screen by clicking on the username in the list
    2. Display Name
    3. Last Login date and time
      1. if last login time is less than 1 hour the time should be displayed time in minutes (rounded)
      2. if last login time is between 1 hour and 1 day time should be displayed in hours (rounded)
      3. if last login time is between 1 day and 7 days, time should be displayed in days (rounded)
      4. if time is more than 7 days, time should be displayed in weeks (rounded)
      5. if user did not log in yet, Last Login value should be set to "Didn't login yet"
    4. Auth method can be
      1. "2FA" if 2-factor authentication is enabled
      2. SFA if 2-factor authentication is disabled
    5. Groups
      1. Groups tab should be displaying all the groups this member is a part of
    6. User has the following quick actions which can be applied to each of the user records in the list:
      1. Edit
        • Takes to the user profile page which can be edited 
      2. Change password
        • Leads to Change Password screen for a selected user
      3. Consents and Data trasnfer
        • Takes to the Consents and Data Transfer screen for a selected user
      4. Lock
        • TBD
      5. Deactivate users
        • TBD
      6.  Delete 
        • Allows to delete user from the system whatsoever
  2. User is able to filter Active users by Group (Design: https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/382949533)
    1. User has "Only Admins" and "Only Locked" filters always visible
    2. User can select one or more groups to filter active users by
      1. Once a filter is enabled, user can clear the selection or remove each individual filter
  3. Mass selection and actions
    1. Designs:
      1. https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/382949533
      2. https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/UAU4L2BVYT6#/screens
      3. https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/GUU4L2X6ENK#/screens
    2. User can select single or multiple entry via a checkbox
    3. User has then mass deactivate and mass delete entries from the list
      1. If “Delete” option is selected confirmation prompt should show up
        • Copy:
          1. For Single user deletion: “Are you sure want to remove all information related to <username> in AuthMachine and all relying parties? This action can not be undone”
          2. For multiple users: “Are you sure want to remove all information related to <users_selected_count> in AuthMachine and all relying parties? This action can not be undone”
  4. User should be able to search by:
    1. Username
    2. Display name (essentialy first name and last name)
  5. Sorting should be available for these fields:
    1. Username: Alphabetical (A->Z and Z->A)
    2. Display name: (A->Z and Z->A)
    3. Last login: Most Recent and Least Recent
fields.short_description: Implement updated Active Users List UI. This section allows admin to view the Active users list and filter them based on the parameters selected

fields.title: Implement updated Add user flow
fields.description:
Task description

This flow covers the process for Admin to add new users to the system

 

Interactive prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/382949538

 

Definition of Done

 

  1. Admin can select a way to add a new User to the system. There are two options available (https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/JXU4L44CUQH#/screens): 
    1. Create user → takes user to the Create User screen
    2. Invite user → takes user to the Invite User screen
  2. Admin can create a new user by providing the following information (design - https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/FVU4L6FUD9R#/screens):
    1. Email (mandatory)
    2. Username (mandatory)
    3. First name and last name 
    4.  User pic 
    5. Define if this user should be pre-activated (TBD with Adrian)
    6. Define if user should be assigned with Admin rights
      1. If this parameter is enabled, user should see a prompt to confirm assigning admin rights (https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/UNU4L87QRYX#/screens)
    7. Assign user to groups (optional)
    8. Define user’s nickname
    9. Select the language this user will use (TBD with Adrian)
    10. Define external ID (TBD with Adrian)
    11. Define user profile URL (TBD with Adrian)
    12. Specify secondary email for this user 
    13. Add phone number
    14. Define user address 
      1. When user clicks Add address they should see this popup (https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/3AU4L6Q4N6Z#/screens)
  3. Errors validation (https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/YPU4L7ARAZU#/screens)
    1. The page should have a validation for having all the required fields filled
      1. If required field is empty it should be highlighted with a following message: “Please add <field_name> to proceed
      2. Email field should have simple email formatting validation
  4. Define what should happen on the end user’s end when their account is set up
fields.short_description: This flow covers the process for Admin to add new users to the system

fields.title: Implement new UI for Pending Activation screen
fields.description:
Task description

This screen would help Admin to see the list of users who were invited to an AuthMachine instance, but did not accept their invitation yet

Interactive prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/383402831

Definition of done

  1. The screen should have a list of pending invitations we’ve sent out
  2. The list should have following fields:
    1. Activation Code - the activation code we’ve sent to a certain user
    2. Invite type - medium which was used to send out an invitation
    3. Email - email which was used to send an invitation
    4. Phone number (if available) - phone number of a user we’ve sent an invitation to
    5. Username
    6. Invited Date
  3. User should be able to search by:
    1. Email
    2. Username
    3. Phone number
  4. Sorting should be available for these fields:
    1. Username: Alphabetical (A->Z and Z->A)
    2. Email: (A->Z and Z->A)
    3. Invited date: Most Recent and Least Recent
  5. Admin should be able to resend an invitation
  6. Admin should be able to delete an invitation
  7. A counter of pending activation codes should be visible on the page
fields.short_description: his screen would help Admin to see the list of users who were invited to an AuthMachine instance, but did not accept their invitation yet

fields.title: Implement new UI for Inactive screen
fields.description:
Task description

On this screen Admin would be able to see the list of de-activated users and have access to reviewing those users’ details and managing their records

Interactive prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/385217264

 

  1. User is able to view the Active Users list, including
    1. Username
      1. User can go to a user details screen by clicking on the username in the list
    2. Display Name
    3. Deactivated from
      1. if “Deactivated from” time is less than 1 hour the time should be displayed time in minutes (rounded)
      2. if “Deactivated from” time is between 1 hour and 1 day time should be displayed in hours (rounded)
      3. if “Deactivated from” time is between 1 day and 7 days, time should be displayed in days (rounded)
      4. if “Deactivated from” is more than 7 days, time should be displayed in weeks (rounded)
    4. Auth method can be
      1. "2FA" if 2-factor authentication is enabled
      2. SFA if 2-factor authentication is disabled
    5. Groups
      1. Groups tab should be displaying all the groups this member is a part of
    6. User has the following quick actions which can be applied to each of the user records in the list:
      1. Edit
        1. Takes to the user profile page which can be edited 
      2. Change password
        1. Leads to Change Password screen for a selected user
      3. Consents and Data transfer
        1. Takes to the Consents and Data Transfer screen for a selected user
      4. Activate users
        1. Moves user to the active users list
      5.  Delete 
        1. Allows to delete user from the system whatsoever
  2. User is able to filter Active users by Group (Design: https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/382949533)
    1. User has "Only Admins" and "Only Locked" filters always visible
    2. User can select one or more groups to filter active users by
      1. Once a filter is enabled, user can clear the selection or remove each individual filter
  3. Mass selection and actions
    1. Designs:
      1. https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/382949533
      2. https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/UAU4L2BVYT6#/screens
      3. https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/GUU4L2X6ENK#/screens
    2. User can select single or multiple entry via a checkbox
    3. User has then mass deactivate and mass delete entries from the list
      1. If “Delete” option is selected confirmation prompt should show up
        1. Copy:
          1. For Single user deletion: “Are you sure want to remove all information related to <username> in AuthMachine and all relying parties? This action can not be undone”
          2. For multiple users: “Are you sure want to remove all information related to <users_selected_count> in AuthMachine and all relying parties? This action can not be undone”
  4. User should be able to search by:
    1. Username
    2. Display name (essentialy first name and last name)
  5. Sorting should be available for these fields:
    1. Username: Alphabetical (A->Z and Z->A)
    2. Display name: (A->Z and Z->A)
    3. Last login: Most Recent and Least Recent
fields.short_description: On this screen Admin would be able to see the list of de-activated users and have access to reviewing those users’ details and managing their records

fields.title: Implement new UI for User Details screen
fields.description:
Task description

This screen is a home for all the details related to a specific user in the system. In terms of this task we are going to reorganise the layout and introduce a bunch of UX improvements to handle those better

It consists of two tabs: 

  • Common Information - where we list all the user parameters/details
  • Permission - where we manage specific permissions this user has

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/383402843

Definition of done

  1. Common information tab has the following fields listed
    1. Email (required, can not be left empty)
    2. Username
    3. Full name: First name and Last Name
    4. Avatar (user can upload an image, delete it)
    5. “Activated” switcher
      1. Admin can deactivate user any time by disabling this attribute
    6. “Admin” switcher
      1. Admin can assign a user with Admin right to have access to all the admin features in the admin panel
    7. Groups (dropdown, multiple select): indicates which groups this user is assigned to
    8. Nick Name
    9. Language: should have a dropdown of available languages. When picked should switch the language for a user to the selected locale (we can have only English for now as we will be adding 
    10. User Type (dropdown, single select): assigns the user with a certain User Type. User types should be pulled from the available user types admin sets in the settings
    11. External ID (TBD with Adrian)
    12. User profile URL (TBD with Adrian)
    13. Specify secondary email for this user 
    14. Add phone number
    15. User address 
    16. Last 10 event log records should be displayed on the page
  2. All off these fields should be editable by the admin by clicking Edit button
  3. Admin should be able to delete the account
  4. Permissions tab should have a list of Objects and Permission Types this user 
    1. Admin should be able to add Permissions to the list
      1. For each permission there must be at least one Object and corresponding Permission type specified
    2. Admin should be able to delete any object/permission type combination
fields.short_description: This screen is a home for all the details related to a specific user in the system. In terms of this task we are going to reorganise the layout and introduce a bunch of UX improvements to handle those better

fields.title: Implement new UI for Groups section
fields.description:
Task description

Groups are an essential part of AuthMachine. A Group serves to simplify user access management permissions by adding user to a group and managing permissions on a group level.

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/B7U4R4IZ3DX#/screens/386102690

Definition of Done

  1. Admin can add any number of groups they want
  2. While creating a group Admin should specify the following:
    1. Group name
    2. Login redirect URL (optional) 
  3. Once group is added, Admin can add Objects and Corresponding permissions types based on the Objects and Permission types available in their account
  4. Admin can add any users from their space to the group
  5. Admin can search users by user name, first name, last name or email
  6. Admin can edit group details
  7. Admin can delete groups
fields.short_description: Groups are an essential part of AuthMachine. A Group serves to simplify user access management permissions by adding user to a group and managing permissions on a group level

fields.title: Design Add group page
fields.description:
Task description

We have Groups page designed and ready to be implemented. However we do not have a design for the flow covering adding a new group to the system

NOTE: Please, make sure you are using Ant Design System (https://ant.design/)

Definition of done

Create a Figma or Sketch file covering the following flow

  1. User is located on the Groups page ( https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/B7U4R4IZ3DX#/screens/386102690)
  2. They click “Add Group” button
  3. There should be a separate page where user can input the following information:
    1. Group Name
    2. Login Redirect URL (should be optional)
fields.short_description: We have Groups page designed and ready to be implemented. However we do not have a design for the flow covering adding a new group to the system

fields.title: Implement Add group page
fields.description:
Task description

We have Groups page designer and ready to be implemented. However we do not have a design for the flow covering adding a new group to the system

 

Prototype/designs

TBD

Definition of done

Create a Figma or Sketch file covering the following flow

  1. User is located on the Groups page ( https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/B7U4R4IZ3DX#/screens/386102690)
  2. They click “Add Group” button
  3. There should be a separate page where user can input the following information:
    1. Group Name
    2. Login Redirect URL (should be optional)
      1. if user defines this redirect URL for a group, it’s members are getting redirected to a particular url if they login directly
fields.short_description: We have Groups page designer and ready to be implemented. However we do not have a design for the flow covering adding a new group to the system

fields.title: Implement Active tab on Devices page
fields.description:
Task description

Active devices page allows admins to monitor active devices their tenants are using and block suspicious devices manually if needed

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/385622270

 

Definition of done

  1. Admin can see all the devices tenants used to authorise with AuthMachine with the following details
    1. Device ID - generated on the backend
    2. Fingerprint - unique ID created based on the number of factors
    3. Type - device type
      1. Desktop
      2. Mobile
    4. Brower - browser name and it’s version
    5. OS - OS version and it’s version
    6. Last event - last logged event for this device
  2. Admin should be able to lock the device from accessing the AuthMachine space
  3. User should be able to search the list by:
    1. ID
    2. Fingerprint
  4. Filters available:
    1. By device type
    2. By Name
    3. By Browser
    4. By OS
  5. Sorting:
    1. ID, Fingerprint, Type, Name, Browser, and OS should be sortable Alphabetically (A → Z and Z → A)
    2. Last event should be sortable by time (Recent → Older, Older → Recent) 
  6. Number of entries should be visible
fields.short_description: Active devices page allows admins to monitor active devices their tenants are using and block suspicious devices manually if needed

fields.title: Implement Blocked tab on Devices page
fields.description:
Task description

Active devices page allows admins to monitor blocked devices their tenants are using and block suspicious devices manually if needed

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386124442

 

  1. Admin can see all the blocked devices tenants used to authorise with AuthMachine with the following details
    1. Device ID - generated on the backend
    2. Fingeprint - unique ID created based on the number of factors
    3. Type - device type
      1. Desktop
      2. Mobile
    4. Brower - browser name and it’s version
    5. OS - OS version and it’s version
    6. Last event - last logged event for this device
  2. Admin should be able to Unblock the device from accessing the AuthMachine space
  3. User should be able to search the list by:
    1. ID
    2. Fingerprint
  4. Filters available:
    1. By device type
    2. By Name
    3. By Browser
    4. By OS
  5. Sorting:
    1. ID, Fingerprint, Type, Name, Browser, and OS should be sortable Alphabetically (A → Z and Z → A)
    2. Last event should be sortable by time (Recent → Older, Older → Recent) 
  6. Number of entries should be visible
fields.short_description: Active devices page allows admins to monitor blocked devices their tenants are using and block suspicious devices manually if needed

fields.title: Implement Device details page in Devices section
fields.description:
Task description

On this page user can see the details for a certain device their tenants used to access thei AuthMachine instance and Block/Unblock a device if needed

Prototype

 

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/385622271

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386124443

Definition of done]

 

  1. Admin should see the Device ID on top of the page
  2. Following info about the device should be available
    1. Device type
    2. Device name
    3. Browser
    4. Operating system
  3. Device Events tab should have last 10 events associated with this device listed
  4. Admin should be able to:
    1. Block a device if it’s active
    2. Unblock a device if it’s Blocked
  5. User should be able to go to the list of Blocked/Active devices from this page
fields.short_description: On this page user can see the details for a certain device their tenants used to access thei AuthMachine instance and Block/Unblock a device if needed

Objects are parts of th

fields.title: Implement Add object page in Objects section
fields.description:

On this screen we should let users create new objects in the system

fields.title: Implement Events list page in Events section
fields.description:
Task description

This screen serves as a register of all the events registered in the system for the user’s directory. 

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/385843699

Definition of done

  1. Any event happening in the system should be displayed in the system
  2. The table should have the columns below:
    1. Date
      1. Displays date and time of the event
    2. Event 
      1. Login
      2. Logout
      3. Activation
      4. Password Reset
      5. Lock
      6. Unlock
      7. Failed Login
    3. User 
      1. User avatar 
      2. User name
    4. Device ID
      1. Unique device identifier
  3. USer should be able to filter events by
    1. Event type
      1. All events is a default fitler
    2. Date 
      1. Date should be defined via the date picker 
      2. Start date and end date should be defined
      3. “All time” is a default filter
    3. Groups
      1. All groups is a default filter
    4. Users
      1. All users is a default filter
  4. User should be able to define the number of records displayed on the page
    1. Available options
      1. 10
      2. 25
      3. 50
      4. 100
  5. User can go to the next page if there are more records than defined in p.4
fields.short_description: This screen serves as a register of all the events registered in the system for the user’s directory

fields.title: Implement General Settings tab in Settings section
fields.description:
Task description

This screen helps users to define URLs used for email notifications and define where the users should be redirected to after successful authorisation

Definition of done

  1. User can define the Base URL for the links placed into email notifications, etc.
    1. URL should be defined as a text field
    2. Basic URL validation should happen when user hits “Save Changes” button. 
  2. User can define the URL for the redirection on successful login.
    1. URL should be defined as a text field
    2. Basic URL validation should happen when user hits “Save Changes” button.
fields.short_description: This screen helps users to define URLs used for email notifications and define where the users should be redirected to after successful authorisation

fields.title: Implement Appearance tab in Settings section
fields.description:
Task description

This section would allow users to modify the default login page

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/387434828

Definition of done

  1. User can define the name of the installation
  2. User should be able to define the Custom CSS for the customer portal
    1. Also, they should be able to preview the resulting page
  3. User can add custom CSS for the header
  4. User can add custom HTML for footer footer
  5. User can define custom HTML for login form header and preview it
  6. User can define custom HTML for footer which appears under forms
  7. User can define custom welcome text for the login page
  8. User can define the text which is displayed on the Sign up link button
fields.short_description: This section would allow users to modify the default login page

fields.title: Implement Security tab in Settings section
fields.description:
Task description

This tab would allow admins to modify security settings for their tenants

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386761928

 

Definition of done

  1. Admin can define if the email confirmation is required for the users signing up for the service
  2. Admin can set up password complexity requirements with a following levels of security
    1. Off: passwords should be not less than 4 symbols
    2. Low: passwords should be 4 symbols minimum and include at least 1 character and at least 1 digit
    3. Medium (default value): passwords should be 4 symbols minimum and include at least 1 lowercase character, 1 uppercase character and at least 1 digit
    4. High: passwords should be 4 symbols minimum and include at least 1 lowercase character, 1 uppercase character, 1 special character and at least 1 digit
  3. Admin should be able to define if it’s allowed to share one-time login codes to users emails when inviting new users 
  4. Admin should be able to define if it’s allowed to share one-time login codes to users phones via SMS when inviting new users 
  5. Admin can define how many of the previously used passwords can not be reused (i.e. user can’t use any of their most recent 5 passwords) 
  6. Admin can define the validity period of users passwords in days
  7. Admin can enable locking accounts if passwords were entered incorrectly certain number of times
  8. Admin can enable reCaptcha for activation and password reset forms
fields.short_description: This tab would allow admins to modify security settings for their tenants

fields.title: Implement Activation tab in Settings section
fields.description:
Task description

This tab would allows admins to let users set their email and phone number during sign up

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386761928

 

Definition of done

  1. Admin can allow users to change their email during the registration
  2. Admin can allow users to change their mobile number during the registration
fields.short_description: This tab would allows admins to let users set their email and phone number during sign up

fields.title: Implement Registration tab in Settings section
fields.description:
Task description

This tab would allow admins to enable or disable self registration feature

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386999119

 

Definition of done

  1. Admin can enable or disable registration feature
  2. If enabled, users can Sign up in addition to being able to sign in to the system
fields.short_description: This tab would allow admins to enable or disable self registration feature

fields.title: Implement Email Sending tab in Settings section
fields.description:
Task description

This tab would allow admin to customise outgoing emails setup so that their users are getting emails from a specific company rather than default setup

Prototype

 https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386999304

Definition of done

  1. User can set administrator’s email address
  2. User can set the address for outgoing email address
    1. The default address is set as `noreply@domainname`
  3. User can define SMTP settings if needed
    1. Username
    2. Password
    3. SMTP port
    4. SMTP host
  4. User can enable TLS for SMTP connections
fields.short_description: This tab would allow admin to customise outgoing emails setup so that their users are getting emails from a specific company rather than default setup

fields.title: Implement Social providers tab in Settings section
fields.description:
Task description

As AuthMachine has integration with social authentication providers, admins should be able to add the providers of their choice to their directory so that their tenants can benefit from easier social auth.

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/383863563

Definition of done

  1. Implement social providers list view, where user can see:
    1. Social provider’s logo
    2. Social provider’s name
    3. Corresponding client ID for enabled social providers
fields.short_description: As AuthMachine has integration with social authentication providers, admins should be able to add the providers of their choice to their directory so that their tenants can benefit from easier social auth

fields.title: Implement Add a provider screen in Social providers list
fields.description:
Task description

As AuthMachine has integration with social authentication providers, admins should be able to add the providers of their choice to their directory so that their tenants can benefit from easier social auth.

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/383863564

Definition of done

  1. User can add a social provider by specifying
    1. Provider 
      1. List can be found here - https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/383863565
    2. Client ID
    3. Client secret
    4. Client key
  2. User can enable trust email provided by the app
fields.short_description: As AuthMachine has integration with social authentication providers, admins should be able to add the providers of their choice to their directory so that their tenants can benefit from easier social auth

fields.title: Implement Applications list in Applications tab in settings
fields.description:
Task description

The whole purpose of AuthMachine is to handle authentication to one or many resources via simple and intuitive process. This screen helps admin in defining which applications/resources should we provide access to

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386360284

Definition of done

  1. User can see which applications tenants of a directory can access to with AuthMachine
  2. Each entry should include
    1. Application icon
    2. Application name
    3. Application URL
    4. Protocol used for authentication
  3. User should be able to go to application details
  4. User should be able to delete applications from the list
fields.short_description: The whole purpose of AuthMachine is to handle authentication to one or many resources via simple and intuitive process. This screen helps admin in defining which applications/resources should we provide access to

fields.title: Implement Add Application screen in Applications tab in settings
fields.description:
Task description

The whole purpose of AuthMachine is to handle authentication to one or many resources via simple and intuitive process. This screen helps admin to add applications to the system

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386360284

Definition of done

  1. User can add a new application to the system by providing the following information
    1. Application name
    2. Image (optional)
    3. Application URL
    4. Single logout URL
    5. Forget user URL
    6. Authentication protocol
      1. Open ID Connect
        1. If selected, require the following properties
          1. Client ID
          2. Secret
          3. Signing algorithm
          4. Redirect URLs
          5. Consent on first login (user can switch it on or off)
      2. Discourse
        1. If selected, require the following properties
          1. Discourse base URL
          2. Client ID
          3. Secret
          4. API Key
          5. API Username
      3. SAML
        1. If selected, require the following properties
          1. Metadata URL
          2. Metadata file
fields.short_description: The whole purpose of AuthMachine is to handle authentication to one or many resources via simple and intuitive process. This screen helps admin to add applications to the system

fields.title: Implement Application Details screen in Applications tab in settings
fields.description:
Task description

The whole purpose of AuthMachine is to handle authentication to one or many resources via simple and intuitive process. This screen handles all the details related to a specific application we are handling authentication for

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386360290

Definition of done

On this screen user can view the details of the each application, including

 

  1. Application name
  2. Image (optional)
  3. Application URL
  4. Single logout URL
  5. Forget user URL
  6. Based on the protocol selected user can see the additional fields
    1. Open ID Connect
      1. If selected, require the following properties
        1. Client ID
        2. Secret
        3. Signing algorithm
        4. Redirect URLs
        5. Consent on first login (user can switch it on or off)
    2. Discourse
      1. If selected, require the following properties
        1. Discourse base URL
        2. Client ID
        3. Secret
        4. API Key
        5. API Username
    3. SAML
      1. If selected, require the following properties
        1. Metadata URL
        2. Metadata file
fields.short_description: The whole purpose of AuthMachine is to handle authentication to one or many resources via simple and intuitive process. This screen handles all the details related to a specific application we are handling authentication for

fields.title: Implement Repositories list view on Repositories screen in Settings
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine allows customers to connect their existing user directories. This list visualises the directories user has connected to their instance

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/385472550

Definition of done

  1. User can see the list of repositories currently added to their instance
  2. The table should contain following fields
    1. Backend type
    2. Backend mode
    3. Name
  3. User should be able to go to any entry details
  4. User can delete the entries from the list
  5. User can go to “Add Repository” page to add a new entry
fields.short_description: AuthMachine allows customers to connect their existing user directories. This list visualises the directories user has connected to their instance

fields.title: Implement Add LDAP repository  on Repositories screen in Settings
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine allows customers to connect their existing user directories. This list visualises the directories user has connected to their instance. This task covers adding LDAP repository to the system.

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/385472551

Definition of done

  1. Once user clicks “Add repository” button here they should be transferred to the backend type selection screen
  2. User should be able to pick LDAP as a backend type
  3. On the next step User has to provide the following details related to the repository
    1. Host
    2. Port
    3. SSL (switch, defines if the system should use SSL or not)
    4. Bind DN (username user to connect to identity repository)
    5. Bind Password (Password used to connect to identity repository)
    6. Backend mode
    7. Authentication switch (defines if AuthMachine uses this repository to authenticate users)
    8. Authentication priority
    9. Provisioning events switcher (defines if AuthMachine should create new users on this repository while activating new users)
    10. Password changes switcher (defines if AuthMachine should be able to change passwords on the connected repository)
  4. User should be able to test connection
    1. Error popup is displayed if connection was unsuccessful
      1. Copy “Connection failed, check connection settings please” 
  5. On the last step, user should be able to select which columns in the repository entry columns should be synced to the AuthMachine user data columns
  6. User should be able to save the repository
fields.short_description: AuthMachine allows customers to connect their existing user directories. This list visualises the directories user has connected to their instance. This task covers adding LDAP repository to the system

fields.title: Implement Add Active directory repository  on Repositories screen in Settings
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine allows customers to connect their existing user directories. This list visualises the directories user has connected to their instance. This task covers adding Active Directory repository to the system.

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/385472551

Definition of done

  1. Once user clicks “Add repository” button here they should be transferred to the backend type selection screen
  2. User should be able to pick LDAP as a backend type
  3. On the next step User has to provide the following details related to the repository
    1. Host
    2. Port
    3. SSL (switch, defines if the system should use SSL or not)
    4. Bind DN (username user to connect to identity repository)
    5. Bind Password (Password used to connect to identity repository)
    6. Backend mode
    7. Authentication switch (defines if AuthMachine uses this repository to authenticate users)
    8. Authentication priority
    9. Provisioning events switcher (defines if AuthMachine should create new users on this repository while activating new users)
    10. Password changes switcher (defines if AuthMachine should be able to change passwords on the connected repository)
  4. User should be able to test connection
    1. Error popup is displayed if connection was unsuccessful
      1. Copy “Connection failed, check connection settings please” 
  5. On the last step, user should be able to select which columns in the repository entry columns should be synced to the AuthMachine user data columns
  6. User should be able to save the repository
fields.short_description: AuthMachine allows customers to connect their existing user directories. This list visualises the directories user has connected to their instance. This task covers adding Active Directory repository to the system

fields.title: Implement Add Database on Repositories screen in Settings
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine allows customers to connect their existing user directories. This list visualises the directories user has connected to their instance. This task covers adding an existing database as repository to the system.

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/385472551

Definition of done

  1. Once user clicks “Add repository” button here they should be transferred to the backend type selection screen
  2. User should be able to pick Database as a backend type
  3. User should provide the following information
    1. Host
    2. Port
    3. Engine
    4. Username
    5. Password
    6. Database name
    7. Table to use
    8. Password format
      1. PBKDF2
      2. Plain
    9. Backend mode
      1. Authentication switch (defines if AuthMachine uses this repository to authenticate users)
      2. Authentication priority
      3. Provisioning events switcher (defines if AuthMachine should create new users on this repository while activating new users)
      4. Password changes switcher (defines if AuthMachine should be able to change passwords on the connected repository)
    10. User should be able to test connection
      1. Error popup is displayed if connection was unsuccessful
        1. Copy “Connection failed, check connection settings please” 
    11. On the last step, user should be able to select which columns in the repository entry columns should be synced to the AuthMachine user data columns
    12. User should be able to save the repository
fields.short_description: AuthMachine allows customers to connect their existing user directories. This list visualises the directories user has connected to their instance. This task covers adding an existing database as repository to the system

fields.title: Implement SAML tab in Settings
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine offers authentication over SAML on certain pricing tiers. This tab allows admin to set up SAML authentication for their tenants

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386999598

Definition of done

  1. Admin can enable or disable SAML authentication feature
  2. If enabled, they should provide
    1. Private Key
    2. Certificate
  3. Admin should be able to save the settings
  4. Admin can update Private Key and/or certificate anytime
fields.short_description: AuthMachine offers authentication over SAML on certain pricing tiers. This tab allows admin to set up SAML authentication for their tenants

fields.title: Implement Policies list view on Policies tab in Settings
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine allows admins to set up access/authentication policies on per application level. This task covers creating a table view displaying all the current policies we’ve set up in the system

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/389545965

Definition of done

  1. User can view the policies active in the system with the following parameters displayed
    1. Policy Title
    2. Policy Type
    3. Accept on login
    4. Accept on activation
  2. User should be able to search policies by policy title
  3. User can sort the table by:
    1. Title (Alphabetically A → Z, Z → A)
    2. Type (Alphabetically A → Z, Z → A)
    3. Accept on login (Alphabetically A → Z, Z → A)
    4. Accept on activation (Alphabetically A → Z, Z → A)
  4. User can go to “Add Policy” screenw
fields.short_description: AuthMachine allows admins to set up access/authentication policies on per application level. This task covers creating a table view displaying all the current policies we’ve set up in the system

fields.title: Implement Add policy view on Policies tab in Settings
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine allows admins to set up access/authentication policies on per application level. This task covers adding a policy to the system. 

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/389545967

Definition of done

  1. Admin can add a new policy by specifying
    1. Policy title
    2. Policy type
    3. Accept on login (one of the types below)
      1. Explicit
      2. Implicit
      3. Disabled
    4. Accept on activation (one of the types below)
      1. Explicit
      2. Implicit
      3. Disabled
fields.short_description: AuthMachine allows admins to set up access/authentication policies on per application level. This task covers adding a policy to the system

fields.title: Implement MFA tab in Settings
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine allows admins to set up Multi-Factor Authentication over Google Authenticator. This tab is supposed to be used by an admin exactly for that. 

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/385475540

Definition of done

  1. Admin can enable or disable Multi-factor authentication by selecting a corresponding option
    1. If disabled - end users can not use Google Authenticator fo authentication
    2. If Allowed - end users can enable or disable Google Authenticator in their User Portal
    3. If Required - end users
fields.short_description: AuthMachine allows admins to set up Multi-Factor Authentication over Google Authenticator. This tab is supposed to be used by an admin exactly for that

fields.title: Implement Adaptive authentication tab in Settings
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine has a feature called Adaptive authentication. In a nutshell, it detects suspicious events in the system and asks for additional verification from the users’ side when it detects a risky event. 

Prototype

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/VSTQ2MSMHTE#/screens/386114352

Definition of done

  1. Admin can enable or disable Adaptive Authentication feature in the settings
  2. If enabled, admin can customise the settings with a following options
    1. Enable requiring verification if user logs in from a new device
    2. Enable requiring verification if user has multi-factor authentication enabled
    3. Require verification if user logs in from a new location. Can be set as
      1. Disabled
      2. New continent
      3. New Country
      4. New City
    4. Whom the verification procedure should apply to
      1. Non-Admins
      2. Admins
      3. All Users
    5. Define verification method. Available methods are: 
      1. Email
      2. SMS
      3. Voice call
      4. Contact support
    6. User can set a default verification method if multiple are selected
    7. If multiple methods are selected, end user can pick a verification method of their choice via User Portal
fields.short_description: AuthMachine has a feature called Adaptive authentication. In a nutshell, it detects suspicious events in the system and asks for additional verification from the users’ side when it detects a risky event

fields.title: Design Google Authentication setup flow in User Portal
fields.description:
Task description

AuthMachine has an integration with Google Authenticator which allows us to use it for a multi-factor authentication. This type of authentication can be enabled or disabled on the global level in the system, however, end user will need to set it up on their end. So, we need to design a flow in the User Portal helping them to do so!

Prototype

Here is the screen where the flow should start from 

https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/WDTXRZ0JF26#/screens/385171429

Definition of done

Design the following

  1. Add “Setup Google Authentication” button to this screen
  2. When user clicks on this button, they should be presented with the following information
    1. QR code we generate on our end
      1. There should be a text line saying “Please, open your Google Authenticator app and scan this QR code)
    2. Security codes 3 security codes will be generated on our end so that user can save those offline and use if they lose their device or decide to change the device
      1. There should be a text line saying “Please, open your Google Authenticator app and scan this QR code)
  3. Once user does that, we should have a state on this screen showing that Google Authenticator is set up and active
  4. Also, there might be two types of setup
    1. Google Authenticator is required by the admin, so end user must set it up
    2. Google Authenticator usage is optional, so that user can decide if they want to enable or disable it
fields.short_description: AuthMachine has an integration with Google Authenticator which allows us to use it for a multi-factor authentication. This type of authentication can be enabled or disabled on the global level in the system, however, end user will need to set it up on their end. So, we need to design a flow in the User Portal helping them to do so!

CTO @LeasePlan. Entrepreneur - AuthMachine, Two Player Chess

fields.text: Hi! I am a software developer with main expertise in JavaScript (both frontend and Node.js) and some Python. I have more than 6 years of experience working with modern JavaScript  I have created several projects from scratch, fully architecting them. I write pragmatic, reliable code which is covered by tests.

My top skills are currently in: web app Back-end development (REST, Server-side), Search and Analytics, AWS Cloud. I also specialize in Front-End web technologies - Vue.js, React.js, along with Back-End: Node.js.                 I have strong background in desktop, web applicatiosn, servers, web scraping/automating and industrial solutions.

I have been developing the projects from the scratch to the market ready app with strong skills and time efficient manner. I work well with others and I look forward to gaining more experience and learning more. I prefer a long-term relationship rather than money.

I am fairly familiar with bot development and asynchronous tasks management.                 I have developed slack, telegram and scraping bots that are integrated with 3rd party apps and APIs.                 In terms of Asynchronous tasks and message brokers, I used celery and RabbitMQ.
Keto With Kelly provides fun and effective diet plans to keep you on track. The diet plan is created based on your preferences and interests. We take care of your taste too.

VATBox, a cloud-based solution that enables companies to reclaim potential value-added tax (VAT) paid abroad. Its solution automatically tracks expenses, as well as produces detailed graphic reports with projected VAT reclaims and information on rejected reclaims. The organisations solution also integrates with various ERP platforms
a full-service portal about home remodeling, where people could get an advice, find professionals and buy products. (Angular, Node, Express, Postgres, Redis, Gulp, Twitter Bootstrap)

I'm well versed in all aspects of development including: front end development, user experience, responsive web design, back end development, databases, source control, testing, and project management.
Please review the portfolio section of my person profile in order to see my latest work. Don't hesitate to invite me to your project and to discuss whether I would be a good fit for it.

I have spent past six years working exclusively in the back-end development. It brings with me both extensive experience in object oriented programming and an organized and detail-oriented work ethic which I believe apply directly to your job requirements including:

My customers are always up-to-date during the development process and are made sure to be happy with the results. Further I also provide any documentation and instructions necessary, to prevent vendor lock-in.

With most of my projects, I am responsible for everything from ground up. This, of course, includes the code of the application, but also the automated pipelines, automated deployments, version control, and Infrastructure-as-Code. I have vast experience with designing and developing system architectures in Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services.
Whether you need to migrate data, design infrastructure, or automate pipelines and deployments, I have the experience and expertise to help.

fields.overview: Hi, I am a designer with experience in creating digital interfaces,                     websites, and print design but I also have the ability to                     bring those concepts to life through creative front-end development for                     small projects.

I am a responsible and autonomous person  I am capable of breaking down complex tasks, providing reasonable estimates and updating status on them, with immediate notifying about blockers. I am always available under discussed hours, and take remote work seriously.

I have a lot of experience improving existing projects, gradually introducing best practices and updating old libraries  I have updated several projects, which allowed us to decrease cost of maintaining them almost twice. I believe codebase should be always maintainable and consistent, well documented and have clear instructions how to run it locally, so onboarding new people is seamless.
